segments.text: As I watch the woman continue drying dishes, I feel a sense of calm wash over me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her routine is almost comforting, like a familiar song.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But that comfort is tinged with anxiety as I glance back at the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water flows like an unruly river, and it’s only getting worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t fathom how she isn’t noticing, it’s infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And then there’s the boy, so close to the cookies, stretching every muscle to grab one.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s the kind of determination that’s both admirable and alarming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside him is hanging on his every move, her anticipation brimming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what would happen if I shouted to warn them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I think, maybe they need this moment, however risky it may be.
segments.speaker: PAR
